headline: U.S. Deploys Forces to Mideast to Deter Iran
summary: The U.S. is deploying a carrier strike group and bombers to the Middle East to serve as a deterrent to Iran based on new intelligence that suggests allied interests and American forces could be imperiled.

headline: U.S.-Stock Funds Rose 3.6% in April, Add to 2019 Gains
summary: During April, two risks that worried investors in 2018, fears about a possible government shutdown and a trade war with China, vanished.

headline: What Is Divergence in Markets?
summary: In Translation: The word divergence gets used in at least two distinct areas of market analysis.

headline: A Bond ETF Tries to Balance Risk
summary: Spotlight: The iShares Edge U.S. Fixed Income Balanced Risk fund has prospered in recent years with a strategy that aims to balance interest-rate risk and credit risk.

headline: Why the Good Times for Growth Stocks May Not Be Over
summary: Many investors believe it’s time for value stocks to take the lead. Not so fast.

headline: ETFs Hope to Connect With 5G Theme
summary: The FIVG trading symbol is already taken, yes, but many other funds are planning to play the 5G theme.

headline: What to Know About ‘Nontransparent’ ETFs
summary: With this new category, managers don’t have to disclose all the fund’s investments every day.

headline: A New Way to Think About Momentum Investing
summary: It’s easier to capitalize on momentum investing if you bet on the hottest factors (like large vs. small), rather than the best-performing actual stocks, a study suggests.

headline: Occidental Raises Cash Portion of Anadarko Bid
summary: Occidental Petroleum revised its offer for Anadarko Petroleum, increasing the cash portion of its bid and removing any requirement for a shareholder vote.

headline: Trump Says Mueller Shouldn’t Testify
summary: President Trump said he didn’t want special counsel Robert Mueller to testify before Congress after a Democrat on the House Judiciary Committee raised hopes the special counsel would appear.

headline: Advocates Push for New York Driver’s Licenses For Undocumented Immigrants
summary: Immigrant advocates are launching an all-out push in the final weeks of the New York legislative session for a bill that would let undocumented immigrants apply for driver’s licenses.

headline: ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Surpasses $2 Billion in Record Time
summary: Walt Disney Co.’s “Avengers: Endgame” became the second-highest-grossing movie of all time, reaching nearly $2.19 billion in global box-office revenue just 12 days after hitting theaters.

headline: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of Monday, May 6, 2019
summary: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of Monday, May 6, 2019

headline: Trump Taps Mark Morgan as Head of Immigration and Customs Enforcement
summary: President Trump said Sunday that he was appointing Mark Morgan, a former Border Patrol chief under the Obama administration, to head Immigration and Customs Enforcement, weeks after the president withdrew his former nominee and said he wanted someone “tougher.”

headline: Buffett Defends Berkshire Amid Lagging Performance
summary: Berkshire Hathaway has underperformed the S&P 500 for a decade, forcing Warren Buffett into a position he rarely resides: on the defensive. At the company’s annual meeting, he urged investors to keep the faith.

headline: The Burdens of BernieCare
summary: Congress’s budget gnomes tip-toe around single-payer’s reality.

headline: Racial Spoils in Washington State
summary: Democrats overrule voters to impose racial and gender preferences.

headline: Britain’s Biggest Losers
summary: The Tories are punished for their Brexit division and incompetence.

headline: Strong Dollar Confronts Clashing Signs
summary: The dollar backed off from a two-year high this past week after a Fed meeting and several key data releases presented investors with conflicting signals on U.S. growth.

headline: Venezuela’s Rebellion That Wasn’t
summary: Guaidó got double-crossed. But Maduro will have to sleep with one eye open.

headline: Blue and White Collars Don’t Fit Every Job
summary: From retail to coding and gigs, today’s work is varied in ways politicians overlook.

headline: Liberals Nod as Comey Begs the Question
summary: If you’re smart, why consider opinions other than your own?

headline: ‘Black Death at the Golden Gate’ Review: San Francisco’s Plague Years
summary: The city’s ﬁrst known victim of the bubonic plague was abandoned at a cofﬁn shop by his roommates before he was dead.

headline: I’m Running to Save Capitalism
summary: Massive deregulation and socialism would both ruin the economic system that allows America to flourish.

headline: Weeding Out Dubious Marijuana Science
summary: Researchers find ways to minimize increases in crime and traffic deaths that followed legalization.

headline: Michael Cohen Was a Bluffer, Not a Fixer
summary: He wasn’t involved in the Trump Organization’s core business.

headline: Don’t Let Warren Politicize Accounting
summary: Her ‘real profits’ tax would hijack GAAP and harm investors and corporate employees alike.

headline: The Kentucky Derby That Veered Off Course
summary: Country House’s win in the 145th Kentucky Derby comes after a tough winter in which the sport dealt with unexplained horse deaths and debates about safety and the future of the horse racing.

headline: Economy Week Ahead: Trade Deficit, Inflation Data
summary: In the week ahead, the U.S. will publish data on inflation and trade. Overseas, Japan will release figures on household spending and Mexico will report on inflation.

headline: Labor’s Numbers Fall but Influence Remains
summary: Shrinkage in members doesn’t mean waning political influence and ability to advance labor’s agenda.

headline: Separate but Equal on American Campuses
summary: As individual groups are isolated by gender, race and religion, they become ideological, each clamoring and fighting among each other for their rightful piece of the economic and political pies.

headline: Big, Gas-Guzzling SUVs Are The Champs for Hard Duty
summary: For actual sport utility, you need interior space, towing capacity, horsepower and range.

headline: Consider This Before Self-Medicating With MDMA
summary: Until MDMA, also known as Ecstasy, is thoroughly vetted via scientific analysis, and until it is made a legal, pure, dose-controlled medication, keep in mind that what you get on the street may not produce the intended outcome.

headline: Pompeo Eager to Resume North Korea Talks
summary: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo played down the threat presented by North Korea’s latest weapons tests and said he is eager for a resumption of talks to end the country’s efforts to acquire nuclear missiles.

headline: A Schmear Campaign Aims at All the Tea in China
summary: New Zealand dairy giant Fonterra is egging on Chinese consumers to take their traditional beverage with cream cheese. And it’s working.

headline: Your Contacts List Is Your Most Important Social Network. Here’s How to Make It Better.
summary: Apps like Cardhop and HiHello help you streamline your contacts app and keep it tidy, so it can become the center of your digital universe—and they promise never to share your data with anyone.

headline: Pope Tells Bulgaria to Welcome Migrants
summary: Pope Francis urged Bulgaria to welcome the migrant flows it currently blocks in his latest statement against rising anti-immigrant sentiment in Europe.

headline: Dean Foods Falters in Shrinking Milk Market
summary: America’s biggest milk maker has hired bankers to review options including a sale of the company, privatization or divestiture of some assets as milk consumption continues to decline in the U.S.

headline: Councilman Wants City to Pay for Armed Guards in Houses of Worship
summary: A New York City councilman plans to introduce a bill this week that would require the city to pay for an armed security guard at any house of worship that requests the protection.

headline: Pompeo, Traveling to Europe, to Address Venezuela, Climate Change
summary: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo is bound for Europe to grapple with international competition for Arctic resources, the spread of Chinese technology, and Russian influence in both Europe and South America, including Venezuela.

headline: Voter Approval Rising for Trump’s Handling of the Economy
summary: A new poll shows President Trump making headway with select groups of Americans who disapprove of his job performance but are willing to credit him for a bustling economy, revealing a block of voters that his re-election campaign is likely to target in the coming months.

headline: Pensions Don’t Always Track How Much Is Borrowed Against Their Names
summary: Over the past several years, a once-marginal type of loan called the subscription line of credit has become all the rage in private equity. These loans let private-equity firms buy companies now and send the bill to investors later.

headline: At New York’s Hudson Yards, Everyone Feels Colder
summary: Hudson Yards, the massive new development in Midtown Manhattan, has luxury shopping, fine dining and art exhibits. It is also one of the chilliest spots in the city.

headline: Macquarie Gets a Foothold in U.S.-Asia Ocean Trade
summary: The Australian investment group’s purchase of a multiyear concession to run the Long Beach Container Terminal in California comes with a guaranteed $9 billion in revenue.

headline: This Man Wants to Mend, Not End, Libor
summary: Financial regulators around the world agree the London interbank offered rate has to go, but they have struggled to find a replacement. Timothy Bowler, president of ICE Benchmark Administration, is pitching a solution.

headline: Sri Lanka Bombers Blew Up Motorcycles, Lost Fingers Honing Deadly Skills
summary: The devastating Easter Sunday bombings in Sri Lanka were locally planned and executed, without direct guidance from the Islamic State militant group, investigators said.

headline: What We’ve Learned About Target-Date Funds, 10 Years Later
summary: A decade after target-date funds were damaged during the financial crisis, they have re-emerged bigger than ever as retirement investments. But they still have vulnerabilities.

headline: Your Fund Fees Might Still Vary More Than They Should—Especially on Index Funds
summary: Many investors feel trapped into paying high fees. Here’s why, and what they can do.

headline: In Tough Times for Hedge Funds, These Are the Ones That Stand Out
summary: The hedge-fund industry has trailed the market for 10 straight years, but our review shows that many smaller funds are doing well.

headline: Trump Issues China Tariff Threat
summary: President Trump threatened to drastically ramp up U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports, a twist that surprised many Chinese officials ahead of planned trade talks this week.

headline: The Cottage Industry for Artists Among the ‘Game of Thrones’ Faithful
summary: From illustrations to sculptures, HBO is showing off standout creations by hobbyists and paying professional artists to produce gallery-quality pieces. Others, meanwhile, operate in a gray area between homage and copyright infringement.

headline: Boeing Knew About Safety-Alert Problem for a Year Before Telling FAA, Airlines
summary: Boeing Co. didn’t share information about a problem with a cockpit safety alert for about a year before the issue drew attention with the October crash of a 737 MAX jet in Indonesia, and then gave some airlines and pilots partial and inconsistent explanations, according to industry and government officials.

headline: Lyft’s Disappointing Debut Looms Large in Uber’s Impending Mega-IPO
summary: As Uber gears up for its landmark IPO, the ride-sharing company and its underwriters are trying to avoid the pitfalls that soured the debut of its smaller rival Lyft.

headline: Israel, Gaza Trade Blows in Deadly Exchanges
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered “massive attacks” on the Gaza Strip as some of the worst fighting in years killed four Israelis and a dozen Palestinians, jeopardizing cease-fire talks.

headline: Trump Shrugs Off North Korean Weapons Test
summary: The Trump administration played down the threat presented by North Korea’s latest weapons tests and said it was eager for a resumption of talks to end the country’s efforts to acquire nuclear missiles.

headline: What Can Stop the Measles Outbreak? Officials Lean on an Unlikely Band of Locals
summary: Public-health officials haven’t been able to stop measles using their standard playbook. They are increasingly counting on an informal network of community groups, religious leaders and others for help, including one nurse who has taken a personal approach to countering antivaccination messages.

headline: Tech Giants Rethink the Businesses That Made Them Big
summary: Google, Facebook and other tech giants have long tinkered with ways to grow outside the core businesses they dominate. Now those efforts are becoming urgent.

headline: Moore, Cain Withdrawals Re-Up Search for Supporters on Fed Board
summary: The White House has renewed its quest for Senate-confirmable candidates for the Federal Reserve Board who will reflect President Trump’s economic priorities, after his previous two choices flamed out in a messy public fashion.

headline: Trump Administration Backs Plan for More Visas for Seasonal Workers
summary: An additional 30,000 seasonal workers could be allowed into the U.S. this summer, a higher-than-expected number, as White House officials have a tug of war over rules for legal immigrant workers.
